intro: Restio neglectus, commonly known as the slender restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants found in coastal and mountainous regions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens.
